unnormalised: ## My Online Shopping Mishaps: A Cautionary Tale
normalised: ## My Online Shopping Mishaps: A Cautionary Tale

unnormalised: So, I've always considered myself pretty tech-savvy. Online shopping? Pfft, a piece of cake! But let me tell you, recent events have humbled me… greatly. It all started innocently enough, with a simple search for a new phone case on Flipkart. The estimated delivery date was showing as 24/07/2024, and I thought, "Perfect! Just in time for my trip." The price? Just Rs. 299. Seemed like a steal.
normalised: So, I've always considered myself pretty tech-savvy. Online shopping? Pfft, a piece of cake! But let me tell you, recent events have humbled me… greatly. It all started innocently enough, with a simple search for a new phone case on Flipkart. The estimated delivery date was showing as twenty fourth july two thousand and twenty four, and I thought, "Perfect! Just in time for my trip." The price? Just rupee two hundred and ninety nine. Seemed like a steal.

unnormalised: I quickly added it to my cart, paid via UPI (thank you, Google Pay!), and got a confirmation message. Transaction ID: 876543210. Everything seemed fine, right? Wrong. A few days later, I checked the tracking information. It said the package was "out for delivery" in a city I’d never even heard of! Something was definitely fishy.
normalised: I quickly added it to my cart, paid via U-P-I (thank you, Google Pay!), and got a confirmation message. Transaction I-D: eight hundred seventy six million five hundred forty three thousand two hundred and ten. Everything seemed fine, right? Wrong. A few days later, I checked the tracking information. It said the package was "out for delivery" in a city I’d never even heard of! Something was definitely fishy.

unnormalised: I tried contacting customer support. After navigating a labyrinth of automated menus and waiting for 45 minutes, I finally got through to a human. They told me there was a “technical glitch” and the package had been misrouted. They promised to investigate and get back to me within 48 hrs. Spoiler alert: they didn’t.
normalised: I tried contacting customer support. After navigating a labyrinth of automated menus and waiting for forty five minutes, I finally got through to a human. They told me there was a “technical glitch” and the package had been misrouted. They promised to investigate and get back to me within forty eight hours. Spoiler alert: they didn’t.

unnormalised: Frustrated, I decided to try another online platform – Amazon. This time, I was looking for a new pair of headphones. I found a pair with a 4.5-star rating and glowing reviews. Price: Rs. 1499. Seemed reasonable enough. I placed the order on 10/07/2024.
normalised: Frustrated, I decided to try another online platform – Amazon. This time, I was looking for a new pair of headphones. I found a pair with a four point five-star rating and glowing reviews. Price: rupee one thousand four hundred and ninety nine. Seemed reasonable enough. I placed the order on tenth july two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: This time, the delivery was prompt! I received the package on 13/07/2024. Eagerly, I ripped open the box... only to find a completely different pair of headphones inside! These were some cheap, off-brand things, clearly not the ones I ordered. The actual value? Probably not more than ₹500.
normalised: This time, the delivery was prompt! I received the package on thirteenth july two thousand and twenty four. Eagerly, I ripped open the box... only to find a completely different pair of headphones inside! These were some cheap, off-brand things, clearly not the ones I ordered. The actual value? Probably not more than rupee five hundred.

unnormalised: So, here I am, two online shopping experiences gone wrong. I've initiated return requests for both items. The refund process for the phone case is "pending," and the estimated refund date is 31/07/2024. The headphone return is still "under review." Lesson learned? Always double-check the seller, read the fine print, and maybe just stick to shopping at the local market. At least there, I can see what I'm getting! And maybe I'll just stick with buying chai for Rs. 20 at my usual stall. Less hassle, same disappointment... just kidding (sort of)!
